body:
Very good question. We discussed this a long time ago.

WakeableLooper is designed non-thread-safe, and we rely on higher level logic to handle this concern. 
For instance, if you take a look at heron-instance source code, you will see there are two threads, Gateway and Slave, and each of them has one WakeableLooper. Data communication between them will be done within a thread-safe Queue, LinkedTransaferQueue; and WakeableLooper will register events in its own thread to listen on that Queue. 
Simply saying, those events-registered interfaces should not be invoked in other threads.

@atibon 
First question, are u using aurora scheduler or mesos scheduler?

" some PC has been assigned 5 container, and some PC has been assigned 1 container."
We rely on aurora/mesos to do the actual scheduling. So how to assign containers for PC is determined by aurora/mesos.

"And Total CPU used in a container is bigger than 3. Maybe something is wrong."
For using aurora/mesos scheduler, we pack topology request into actual aurora/mesos request to ask them to do the actual scheduling. Could u share the resource requirement on aurora ui or mesos ui? Then we can check whether it is an issue related to resource request transformation, or it is something related to aurora/mesos.

Also, I don't understand "upload picture failed..."

I've implemented a method to check the thread safety whenever adding event to timer queue. 
https://github.com/kennylbj/heron/blob/master/heron/common/src/java/com/twitter/heron/common/basics/WakeableLooper.java
Maybe get some overhead but gain more safety.

Should i pull a request for that implementation or just remain the current design?

Let's keep current design for now. It is a low level library shared in a lot of places; need more careful experiments and thoughts. 

For instance, you mentioned "Maybe get some overhead", could we quantify the overhead, in basic library benchmark, simple topoogies and normal production topologies?

I deployed a topology on a YARN cluster. `.pex` directory is created inside container's working directory. I do not see the `permission denied` error any more.

In addition to this - we might need additional fields to indicate - 
- Indicate whether the topology is written in C++/Java/Python/Go etc
- Higher level framework used as Summingbird, TSAR, SQL, etc

This will be helpful later I believe.

@billonahill - I was more worried about the migration within Twitter.  If we can consolidate the changes into one release - it makes it little less painful. Otherwise, we can do it a different PR?
@mycFelix - that could be because of trident? currently heron does not support trident.

@kramasamy @billonahill I added an [enum](https://github.com/taishi8117/heron/blob/6ee9816527157c349ea1061edb60d184a79e0488/heron/proto/topology.proto#L36) to specify language, for which I added Java and Python for now, but I think it's easily extensible by adding new languages to the enum later.

I was advocating not blocking/coupling this PR with the feature you're talking about. It's best to separate features into different PRs/issue for better tracking.

We can put other things in this release if we want to, but let's deal with it separately.

Fine with me.

Looks good!

@kramasamy - [homebrew-core](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/master/share/doc/homebrew/Acceptable-Formulae.md#we-dont-like-binary-formulae) requires Heron built from source. Otherwise, it needs to go into [homebrew-cask](https://github.com/caskroom/homebrew-cask). However, homebrew-cask only supports downloading a compressed package instead of an install binary like Heron does. It requires Heron releases a bundled tar that contains all install scripts.

I was thinking to submit a PR to https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-binary but it's just deprecated recently :(.
@caofangkun I'll close this PR if there is no further activity.
👍  @maosongfu do you have any feedback on this?
👍 @billonahill - do you have any other feedback?

Here is my review of this PR. Please bear with me.

#### README.md

First of all, your [README.md](https://github.com/prabhuinbarajan/heron-1/blob/ec5fbfe959aae67dc3f171099aefeb5c887a292c/heron/cli/src/python/README.md) makes little sense to me. What do you mean by "pattern"? I can barely understand what you mean by "precedence"? Do you mean "order"? What is "To run/Test"? What is `cp.heronrc.sample $HOME/.heronrc`? Do you mean `cp .heronrc.sample $HOME/.heronrc`?

#### Code

Please fix indentation. We enforce Python indentation level to be 2. There are simply too many parts of your code that need to be fixed, and I don't have time to add specific comment and suggestion to each of them.

#### Test

Please add test under `heron/cli/test/python`. Running test manually is not a viable approach in such a large project.

`SchedulerMain.runScheduler()` also has overlapping code with `SubmitterMain.submitTopology` (for object initialization).

What dead code are you referring to in `heron-executor.py`?

Since you group config by "precedence", I think it would be better to put each piece of comment on a separate line and stop supporting trailing comment. For example:

```
# command specific
activate:* --config-path cmd-activate-*  

# role and command specific
submit:devcluster/ads/PROD --config-path cmd-submit-role  
activate:devcluster/ads/PROD --config-path cmd-activate-role

# global
--config-path hello   
*:* --config-path hello-global

```
I do not see any users of this code: https://github.com/ashvina/heron/commit/7b6a5b97b4e1033bbdb21f36ad5fa06474fa8e25
@objmagic - please do not close this. we need to think about the design and communicate it to @caofangkun
Also, please try `pylint --rcfile=heron/tools/python/checkstyle.ini heron/cli/src/python/argparser.py` to lint your code. You can use `pip install pylint --user` to install `pylint`.
👍 for the change but please check on the CI failure before shipping.
@taishi8117 - can you look at the tracker code as well to ensure these changes do not affect? This is because tracker code use these protos as well.
tuple.getSourceComponent() is implemented, though tuple.getSourceTask() is not implemented.
looks good to me. Please make sure the change does not break any existing components.

@kramasamy This version of the round robin packing algorithm will by default return a null packing if the number of containers specified by the user is not sufficient to satisfy the resource requirements of the components. Optionally the user can configure the algorithm (using topologyConfig) to automatically increase the number of containers if the user-specified number is not sufficient so that a packing plan is created. Is this an acceptable behavior? Let me know if you agree with the defaults.
there is no error when killing topology. @kramasamy tried again and the error is gone. However, I'll improve the logging.
can be combined with #1159 now

One option can be have our own Kafka Spout (can be modified from existing storm one) and put into heron-contrib repo or folder.
@nlu90 We may need to check completely whether all necessary dependencies are included at one shot. There might be more than just this one.

As far as i can tell reflectasm does not have any compiled dependencies: https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.esotericsoftware/reflectasm and it is the only compiled dependency listed for https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.esotericsoftware/kryo/3.0.3

If there has something the community has to do, `heron-kafka-spout` probably is the best option. 

However,it is my personal view.There might be a lot of `kafka-spout` users and their voice should be considered too.
